intro: Thesium alatavicum, commonly known as the New Zealand thesium, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest undergrowth. Thesium alatavicum is notable for its ecological role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
